results.title: An Animated Atlas of the World (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mike West and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Strongman, Atlas, is the humorous animated host of this tour around the globe. Sounding like the recent movie hero “Rocky”, Atlas provides accurate information on weather, wind, tides, storms and general geography for each country he visits. The film combines animation and some short live-action segments.

results.title: An American werewolf in London [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Landis, George Folsey Jr and Lycanthrope Films
results.brief_description: David and Jack are two American backpackers off for a three-month trek of Europe. Whilst wandering the desolate English countryside they happen upon a quaint pub with a mysterious patron who warns them not to leave the road when walking after dark. Ignoring such advice (as characters in horror films always do), the two inevitably find themselves lost in the moors being circled by a strange beast who attacks and kills Jack. David wakes up in a London hospital with nasty scratch wounds to his cheek and shoulder, and Jack soon appears, freshly deceased and rapidly decomposing, to deliver the grim news that David will in fact turn into a werewolf the next full moon. David dismisses the encounter as a hallucination, but all indications point to lycanthrope. Cast includes: David Naughton, Jenny Agutter and Griffin Dunne.

results.title: An American tail: Fievel goes west
results.creator_credit: Phil Nibbelink, Simon Wells, Robert Watts, Steven Spielberg and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Fievel, the brave young mouse from the much loved “An American tail” returns in this Wild West adventure. Life is hard for the Mousekewitz family who struggle to make ends meet and to keep their dreams alive. Tanya wants to become a singer and Fievel wants to be like his hero Wylie Burp. Lured out West by crafty Cat R. Waul, Fievel uncovers a dastardly plot to turn new settlers into mouse burgers. With the help of his cat friend Tiger and the feared Wylie Burp, Fievel saves the day. Features the voices of James Stewart, John Cleese, Dom DeLuise and Amy Irving with Linda Ronstadt singing the song “Dreams to Dream”.

results.title: An Agricultural Officer in Papua and New Guinea
results.creator_credit: William Shepherd, Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Presents the work being done in Papua and New Guinea by the Department of Agriculture to produce better stock and crops, and the opportunities for young men in this field. Various special training and research centres are shown, including the veterinary laboratory, rubber experimental station, cattle breeding station, and extension centres where people are trained as Agricultural Field Assistants.

results.title: An African community: the Masai
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardonyi, Clifford Janoff and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: This film shows how the nomadic Masai live in the highlands of East Africa. It describes their dependence on the land, their adaptation to the environment, and their family and tribal interdependence. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: An Actor's revenge
results.creator_credit: Kon Ichikawa, Masaichi Nagata and Daiei Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: Starring Kazuo Hasegawa, a Japanese matinee idol, this is the story of a kabuki actor who plans a long suffering revenge on the men who drove his parents to suicide. A melodrama, this film jumps from the swooning romanticism of the kabuki and its traditional music to stylised action and Hollywood jazz. At the centre of this, Hasegawa brushes aside his advancing years and delivers performances of enduring skill and charm.

results.title: Amy!
results.creator_credit: Laura Mulvey, Peter Wollen and Modelmark
results.brief_description: Part newsreel and part biography, this film takes as its subject, the life story of the legendary aviatrix Amy Johnson who was the first woman to fly solo from England to Australia. Mulvey and Wollen pursue their concern, developing radical strategies through a sustained discussion, by a women’s group, of what the “heroic” image means to women including questions of feminism and representation. A commentary on ‘philovatism’ (the desire for thrills) seeks to explain Johnson’s exploits in psychoanalytic terms. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Amy is a tiger
results.creator_credit: Keith Hall and Cameracraft Film Productions
results.brief_description: A promotional film for industrial development in Queensland. A Canadian, visiting Queensland to report on business prospects and industrialization, charters Amy, an elderly Tiger Moth, to take him to the industrially important areas of the State.

results.title: Amore
results.brief_description:
Michel, a young architect is sent by the French government to Venice with a mision to try and find a solution to save an island. Paolo, a young photographer, offers to help Michel in his discovery of the city. He also introduces him to the beautiful Marina.

Credits: Director, Henry Chapier ; writers, Anne Capelle, Henry Chapier ; photoraphy, Alain Derobe ; music, Vangelis Papathanassiou.
Cast: Sonia Petrova, Daniel Quenaud, Julian Negulesco, Henri Deus, Daniel Ceccaldi.

results.title: Amisk
results.creator_credit: Alanis Obomsawin, Dorothy Courtois, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A week-long festival was organised by a group of Montreal citizens to raise funds in support of the Cree Indians who stood to lose their land because of the James Bay hydro-electric project. This film alternates between the spectacular performances of the Indian and Inuit peoples and the meeting halls of Mistassini where they talk of their past to defend their future.
